forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Slight Chance Drizzle
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. South wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 10am, then rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 5 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle shroud of clouds blankets the landscape, with the likely arrival of light drizzle whispering through the early morning hours. As the evening deepens, the cool air settles around 49 degrees, a reminder of the ever-present maritime embrace of this city. The winds murmur softly from the south, offering a mild breath against the skin. 

As dawn approaches, tomorrow beckons with a delicate promise of rain—a fleeting chance before ten, replaced by the thrum of raindrops tapping against windows and rooftops. By midday, the sun may peek through, spilling fragments of warmth amidst the gray, while temperatures hover around a fitting 61 degrees, then recede to a brisk 57 in the afternoon. Dress in layers, embracing the cool, damp air; a light jacket accompanied by a scarf will shield you from the chill, while sturdy shoes will serve well against puddles that are destined to form. These conditions set a tone perfect for a quiet stroll beneath a canopy of falling leaves, perhaps visiting a cozy café with rich brews that smooth the edges of any drizzle that persists.
